attributes.additional_details: Apart from the disruption to over-stretched schools it unfairly penalises pupils with almost 1,000 pupils at 29 schools due to take Latin at GCSE, as well as several thousands more pupils studying Latin at key stage 3. It removes yet another avenue of social mobility and levels the playing field between the state and private sector. If there is a belief in a well rounded ecucated population, the future critical thinkers, analysts and teachers the cancellation is short sighted and franly unfair.
attributes.background: Reinstate the Latin Excellence Programme (LEP) if not in full at least for the rest of this academic year.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition that call for the same action:

Do not cut funding from the Latin Excellence Programme
